page.title: 19KETLEY BANK LANDSCAPE
page.content: Mossey Green is unused land. The landscape is grass, weeds and gorse bushes. There is a mobile home park here. Forge Hill is by the Forge Interchange. There are many trees, lots of clover and skylarks here. From this hill can be seen many new roads. The M54 is the most important. Forge Junction joins the M54 from the Wellington by-pass. The main structure here is a large reinforced concrete over-bridge which spans a fault in the ground. This is known as the Lightmoor Fault. The bridge took 16 hours to complete having required a continuous pour of 900 cubic metres of concrete. The Rock is so called because it stands on stone. Most houses are council owned. The open land is mostly rough grazing.
